thread.title: Ashland, Mount Union will likely continue streaks this weekend: Local D2, D3 Football 2015
thread.title_full: Ashland, Mount Union will likely continue streaks this weekend: Local D2, D3 Football 2015 | cleveland.com

author: Branson Wright, The Plain Dealer
title: Ashland, Mount Union will likely continue streaks this weekend: Local D2, D3 Football 2015
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Ashland is 5-0 and the last time it started the season with five straight wins was in 2012. That was the same season the Eagles finished 11-1 and made the playoffs in Division II.
Ashland is currently ranked No. 9 in the nation in Division II and there's a good chance the Eagles will extend their streak when against winless Saginaw Valley State at 7 p.m. Saturday. Listen to the live audio here.
It is likely another undefeated team, Mount Union (4-0), will extend its streak when it hosts Ohio Northern (3-1) at 1:30. Online Coverage: Live Stats | LIVE WDPN Audio | LIVE WRMU Audio | Live Video (pay-per-view)
The Purple Raiders, ranked No. 2 in Division III, have won nine straight meetings after Ohio Northern's 21-14 win in 2005 in Alliance. Ohio Northern has faced a double-digit deficit in every game this year and rallied to win three of them. In their lone loss, 28-27 to Baldwin-Wallace, the Polar Bears missed three field goals and an extra point.
Baldwin-Wallace (2-2) will host Marietta (1-3) at 2 p.m. Saturday at Tressel Field at The George Finnie Stadium. Live radio here.
BW quarterback Tyler Moeglin leads the team with 613 yards and four touchdowns. He also leads the team in rushing with 406 yards. Bryon Cook , who caught a career-high nine passes a week ago, leads the team with 18 receptions for 223 yards and three touchdowns.
Here are the remaining games involving local Division II teams on Saturday:
Notre Dame (1-4) at West Virginia State (3-2), 1:30 p.m., Live stats Findlay (3-2) at Walsh (0-5), Noon, Live stats Urbana (1-4) at Lake Erie College (1-4), 1 p.m., Live audio Here are the remaining games involving local Division III teams on Saturday:
Hiram (0-4) at Denison (4-0), 7 p.m., Live video Wabash College (4-0) at Oberlin (2-3), 1 p.m., Live video Waynesburg (2-3) at Case Western Reserve (3-1), 1:30 p.m., Live stats Wilmington (1-3) at John Carroll (3-1), 1:30 p.m., Live audio
